"N-NO!" I shouted. "This isn't fair! IT'S NOT FAIR!!!" I tried raising my power-level to my maximum as I got mad. "I finally had an answer! I finally had the power to fix my life! Make everything that went wrong right again! I've lost so much!!! IT'S NOT FAIR! I finally was stronger than everyone! I was finally someone special! Now you've taken this away from me! NO! I've Lost TOO MUCH ALREADY! I WON'T LOOSE THIS TOO!!!"

I originally thought I was just blowing hot air, but I suddenly felt something. My power suddenly boiled over past my limit. I was getting stronger. My muscles tightened up more. Maybe with my anger, I could potentially get as strong as I need to be. Vegeta looked on curiously, but he soon raised his fists, ready for the next round.

"This fight isn't over yet!" I yelled. I suddenly shot forward at top speed. I jabbed at his face, but he ducked underneath it. I anticipated that he would dodge. So I swung my knee up and struck him in the side. He was caught off guard by the attack - I had him. I began to pummel his face as quickly as I could. Vegeta put his hands up again to block my attacks and divert them away. He began to return his own. I blocked most of them, but I just barreled through the pain of the attacks he landed. He punched toward me - I now had an opportunity.

I sidestepped out of the way of the attack, raising my right arm. I snapped my elbow down on his, and locked his arm against my side. He was surprised that I now had him in a lock. Suddenly I thrust my left fist into his face over and over. He'd reel back from each strike and would be pulled back forward because of his restrained arm, bringing his face back into my fist every time I threw another punch. I now managed to get his nose to bleed.

The cycle ended when he managed to throw up his hand and grab my wrist. He then tied up my arm in his - locking me in a similar fashion to what I had done. We were both restrained, unable to move now. Vegeta was smiling.
"It appears we've reached an impasse," he said with that confident smirk.

I said nothing, other than gritting my teeth. I leaned my head back and suddenly thrust it into Vegeta's face. He grunted in pain upon impact, but I wasn't done. I headbutted him again, and again, and again until his grip on my arm released. I then released his arm, and both of his hands went to his face after the final headbutt knocked him back.

"AAAAAAARGH!" he yelled as his hands went to his bruised face. I wiped some sweat from my forehead, lightly feeling a bruise on the top of my head. He continued to grunt and shake. "UGH! WHAT'S YOUR HEAD MADE OUT OF?! Your skull must be thicker than Kakarot's!!! OW!"

"Kakarot, huh?" I asked. "Is that a friend of yours? Good - once I'm done with you; he's next!"

He finally pulled his hands away from his face slowly to glare at me. "Don't. Get. So. CONFIDENT!!!" he yelled at me. Out of nowhere he began shooting Ki Blasts at me. Seeing them, I instinctively began flying off to the side. He pursued me and began shooting where I was going to be. I stopped when I got wise to his plan and immediately began flying towards him. He shot strait at me. I evaded by going under, and by then I was on him.

I struck him hard in the stomach. He grunted and bent over, clutching his stomach. I got above him and grabbed his head, locking it the curve of my elbow, to keep him facing down. Now that his head was locked he began to thrash about - but I had used this technique on my brother often. I knew I had him. I raised my hand and began punching him in the right kidney. He grunted and yelled with each strike. I kept hitting him as hard as I could.

But after a few strikes, showing amazing acrobatic ability, he flung the lower half of his body up toward me. Before I knew it, my head was seized between his legs. After the initial shock, I had to release his head to try and pry his thighs off of my neck before I choked. He suddenly sprang the top half of his body up and began to punch me in the face several times. He finally pulled back for a stronger punch. When it connected with my nose, he released his legs allowing me to fly back. He then kicked me away, making me fly faster.

"I will not be humiliated by ANOTHER Lower-Class Weakling like you!" he said. I grinned. Not only did I hurt his body, but I hurt his pride as well. I was ready - he might be stronger than me, but at this point, there was no way I was ever going to stop. I'd keep coming at him from every angle I could. And I would eventually wear him down. I couldn't wait to see the look on his face when he realized that a Pathetic Human was the one who beat him. "You think you're so tough?!" he asked me. "Wait until you handle THIS!"

He stretched a hand toward me. I saw his palm light up with a Ki Blast. But this one was different - it was bluish white instead of yellow like normal. And as soon as he formed it in his hand, it suddenly began to grow. It was much larger than any I had fired - even the double large one I fired at Capsule Corps a few minutes ago. It was gigantic!
"Let's see how confident you are after my favorite technique," he said. "MY BIG BANG ATTACK!!!"

He bent his arm back and snapped it forward - firing the Energy Ball. It came at me like a Meteor! This time, it was I trapped like a deer in the headlights of an oncoming car. Except THIS time, it was like an oncoming train! All that energy would without a doubt vaporize me! I had to dodge, but I looked back on the street behind me. It was facing away from Capsule Corps, and was going to strike the street and take out a few buildings. Worst of all, there were also people on the street who had gathered to watch the fight. If I moved out of the way, the blast would kill them instead.

While I was more than willing to take down Capsule Corps because I was angry, I couldn't condone these people being killed because of me. They were innocent in all of this. I looked forward and the ball was coming closer. What was I going to do? Could I...possibly catch it and throw it away? Or would I dodge and let them suffer because of my foolishness? My conscience got the better of me and I knew what had to be done. I threw up my arms out in front of me with the intent of stopping the attack.
121111111111111111111.title: The Final Round Begins

1211111111111111111111.content:
I held my arms out to stop Vegeta's "Big Bang Attack" - if it was anything like it's namesake, I knew I couldn't let this ball touch the Earth. It was approaching fast. It was already so close that I could feel my hands and arms burning. It felt like the sun was coming right at me. I overestimated myself yet again. Maybe perhaps with me in its path, the ball would explode and just take me out with it. At least my conscience would be clear. I turned my head away and closed my eyes and waited for the inevitable pain.

Suddenly I felt that strange feeling again. I opened my eyes as it shot through my mind. It gave me this gut feeling that there was someone else here. Vegeta? No - not Vegeta. It was someone else...Someone stronger.

"HAAAAAAAAAAA!!!" I heard someone yell. It wasn't Vegeta - it was someone else. Suddenly - a bright blue light shined across the area - striking against our bodies - Vegeta's and mine. From off to the left side above each of us, a blue energy beam was fired. It struck the Big Bang Energy Ball and began to push it out of the collision course with me. The ball was pushed away until it exploded harmlessly above the buildings. The force of the blast pushed smoke and wind toward me and Vegeta. I covered my eyes with my arms to protect myself.

When the dust settled I looked about for whoever shot the beam. I suddenly spotted a man hovering in the sky above us. He was wearing a large, orange, training gi over a deep blue undershirt. He wore matching dark blue wrist-bands and boots, and he had a dark blue sash tied around his waist to serve as little more than a belt. His hair was dark black and was spiky in a strange formation. I honestly wouldn't know how to describe it in words.
He hovered there, panting - his two arms outstretched toward the area between Vegeta and myself. I saw smoke rising from his outstretched palms and he took heavy, panting breaths. I looked at the face of this man and I got that feeling again. It gave me a different feeling than when I sensed Vegeta. Something inside me told me that this person was a good man...a kind man.

"Hey Vegeta - what's the matter with you?!" he yelled at him. "With that much energy, you could've blown the whole city up!"

Vegeta growled in frustration. "Grrrrr - I should've known you'd show yourself sooner or later, Kakarot!"

Kakarot?! I thought to myself. I looked up at him again. So...that guy is friends with this Jerk? He can't be...Why would he be friends with an ego-maniacal psychopath like Vegeta?

"This was the energy I was sensing the other day, Vegeta," this new-person told him. "I told you - and I was right; he's a Super Saiyan!"

That word caught my attention...A Super...What?

Suddenly this Kakarot person began to hover toward me. I braced myself for anything that could happen, but I was so fatigued I could barely lift my arms. If this situation turned ugly, I didn't know what I could do to defend myself. And regardless of how good I felt this Kakarot was, I was the one who tried to destroy a major office building a few minutes ago. And he was definitely more powerful than Vegeta. I had to be cautious - not knowing what to expect.
